item.title: Fishing and cooking error
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

why dont you make a fishing controller

void fishingController(int playerID, int typeFish,int reqLvl,int XP){

sendMsg("You fish a "+ GetItemName(typeFish) + “!”);
}

etc… not going to do it all for you… but fishing controllers cut down the amount of code you use by atleast 50% and are easier to make changes for…

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing and cooking error
item.dc:creator: @cwg452003 cwg452003
item.description:
@cwg452003 wrote:

So for the fishin this is what i added to the server

else if(useItemID == 301 && atObjectID == 42 && playerLevel[7] >= 0)//Fish Lobster { sendMessage("You begin to fish..."); addSkillXP((2000*playerLevel[10]), 10); addItem(377, 1); sendMessage("You fish a lobster!"); } else if(useItemID == 311 && atObjectID == 42 && playerLevel[7] >= 25)//Fish Swordfish { sendMessage("You begin to fish..."); addSkillXP((4000*playerLevel[10]), 10); addItem(371, 1); sendMessage("You fish a swordfish!"); } else if(playerLevel[7] <= 24) { sendMessage("You need a fishing level of 25 to fish these fish."); } else if(useItemID == 305 && atObjectID == 44 && playerLevel[7] >= 50)//Fish Manta Ray { sendMessage("You begin to fish..."); addSkillXP((6000*playerLevel[10]), 10); addItem(389, 1); sendMessage("You fish a manta ray!"); } else if(playerLevel[7] <= 49) { sendMessage("You need a fishing level of 50 to fish these fish."); } else if(useItemID == 305 && atObjectID == 45 && playerLevel[7] >= 75)//Fish Sea Turtle { sendMessage("You begin to fish..."); addSkillXP((8000*playerLevel[10]), 10); addItem(395, 1); sendMessage("You fish a sea turtle!"); } else if(playerLevel[7] <= 74) { sendMessage("You need a fishing level of 75 to fish these fish."); } else if(useItemID == 305 && atObjectID == 46 && playerLevel[7] >= 100)//Fish Shark { sendMessage("You begin to fish..."); addSkillXP((10000*playerLevel[10]), 10); addItem(383, 1); sendMessage("You fish a shark!"); } else if(playerLevel[7] <= 99) { sendMessage("You need a fishing level of 100 to fish these fish."); }
So i made a noob account to test it out, so since i was level one fishing the only thing that working was the lobster pot on fishing spot number 42 to fish lobbies, but then all others said u need a fishing level of 25 to fish these fish when that was only the swordfish, and before i added this i tested out cooking and everything cooked fine now it’s saying i need 25 fishing to cook everything?!?! i’m like fishing for cooking? it’s all messed up.

Read full topic
